page.title: 01OVERVIEW OF THE GRID
page.content: THE AREA WITHIN THE GRID IS MAINLY OPEN FARMLAND WHICH BORDERS THE NORTH OF THE TOWN OF COLCHESTER.TO THE NORTH LIES THE VILLAGE OF GREAT HORKESLEY, AND TO THE NORTH EAST LIES THE VILLAGE OF BOXTED. MOST OF THE PEOPLE WHO LIVE IN THIS AREA WORK OR GO TO SCHOOL IN NEARBY COLCHESTER.A GREAT NUMBER OF PEOPLE DO ACTUALLY WORK WITHIN THIS GRID MOST OF THEM WORKING ON THEIR OWN FARMS OR FOR ONE OF THE MANY FRUIT FARMS WHICH ARE OWNED BY WEALTHY LOCAL PEOPLE OR BY LARGE COMPANIES IN LONDON. COLCHESTER IS A VERY FAST DEVELOPING TOWN AND IS ALSO A PROSPEROUS ONE_THIS IS REFLECTED IN THE GROWING NUMBERS OF PEOPLE WHO ARE MOVING INTO THE COUNTRY AND WHO ARE BUYING UP LARGER OLD HOUSES AND THE MANY NEW EXECUTIVE HOUSES NOW BEING BUILT.
